bug.short_desc: Failure when deserializing configuration from JSON when save password not checked

long_desc.thetext:
1. Create a repository with user credentials. 2. Leave "Save Password" unchecked. 3. On restart, I get the following exception:
!ENTRY org.eclipse.mylyn.gerrit.core 4 0 2013-10-07 11:23:14.686 !MESSAGE Failed to deserialize configuration: 'null' !STACK 0 java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: at org.eclipse.core.runtime.Assert.isLegal(Assert.java:63) at org.eclipse.core.runtime.Assert.isLegal(Assert.java:47) at org.eclipse.mylyn.internal.gerrit.core.client.JSonSupport.parseResponse(JSonSupport.java:214) at org.eclipse.mylyn.internal.gerrit.core.GerritConnector.configurationFromString(GerritConnector.java:360) at org.eclipse.mylyn.internal.gerrit.core.GerritConnector.loadConfiguration(GerritConnector.java:336) at org.eclipse.mylyn.internal.gerrit.core.GerritConnector.createReviewClient(GerritConnector.java:315) at org.eclipse.mylyn.reviews.core.spi.ReviewsConnector.getReviewClient(ReviewsConnector.java:30) at org.eclipse.mylyn.reviews.ui.spi.editor.AbstractReviewTaskEditorPage.getFactoryProvider(AbstractReviewTaskEditorPage.java:125) at org.eclipse.mylyn.reviews.ui.spi.editor.AbstractReviewTaskEditorPage.checkIfModelIsCached(AbstractReviewTaskEditorPage.java:80) at org.eclipse.mylyn.reviews.ui.spi.editor.AbstractReviewTaskEditorPage.init(AbstractReviewTaskEditorPage.java:68) at org.eclipse.ui.forms.editor.FormEditor.registerPage(FormEditor.java:657) at org.eclipse.ui.forms.editor.FormEditor.configurePage(FormEditor.java:348) at org.eclipse.ui.forms.editor.FormEditor.addPage(FormEditor.java:190) at org.eclipse.mylyn.tasks.ui.editors.TaskEditor.addPages(TaskEditor.java:410) at org.eclipse.ui.forms.editor.FormEditor.createPages(FormEditor.java:138) at org.eclipse.ui.forms.editor.SharedHeaderFormEditor.createPages(SharedHeaderFormEditor.java:98) at org.eclipse.mylyn.tasks.ui.editors.TaskEditor.createPages(TaskEditor.java:196)

I'm wondering if we should add a null check to loadConfiguration()? It seems that this is a common scenario when configuration has not yet been saved to the repository. Wouldn't we want to create a default configuration in that case? It seems a bit weird to deserialize null and then use the result of that. I just took a quick look so I might be missing something.

(In reply to Steffen Pingel from comment #2) > I'm wondering if we should add a null check to loadConfiguration()? It seems > that this is a common scenario when configuration has not yet been saved to > the repository. Wouldn't we want to create a default configuration in that > case?
Yeah, IIRC that was what I was trying to get at w/ https://git.eclipse.org/r/#/c/14328/3/org.eclipse.mylyn.gerrit.core/src/org/eclipse/mylyn/internal/gerrit/core/client/GerritConfiguration.java After that it got (probably needlessly) more complicated... https://git.eclipse.org/r/#/c/14294
Tomek, I pushed an alternative approach. It would be great if you could take a look at the latest patch set.
